intro: Dubautia molokaiensis, commonly known as Moloka`i daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Moloka`i. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Dubautia molokaiensis is considered a rare and endangered species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
